item.description:
As America remains embroiled in conflict overseas, a less visible war is taking place at home, costing countless lives, destroying families, and inflicting untold damage on future generations of Americans. Over forty years, the War on Drugs has accounted for more than 45 million arrests, made America the worldâ€™s largest jailer, and damaged poor communities at home and abroad. Dr. Mary Fran T. Malone, Professor of Political Science at UNH will lead the post-film discussion.
NR, 108 mins, US

item.name: Screening of "The House I Live In"
